body.p: Paragraphs 6.83–6.86 describe an approach that uses one measurement basis in the statement of financial position and a different measurement basis in the statement of profit or loss. When this approach is used, reclassification is the only way to ensure that, over the holding period of the asset or liability, the cumulative amount of income or expenses included in the statement of profit or loss for that asset or liability is the amount determined using the measurement basis selected for that statement.
